line_2: To calm the soul, and wipe off every tear,

line_1: O! rather all your wonted joys renew!
line_2: If life I leave, I leave its troubles too:

line_1: If life I leave, I leave its troubles too:
line_2: O! rather all your wonted joys renew!

line_1: For, if my happy soul to God ascends,
line_2: Or in mere nothing if my being ends,

line_1: Or in mere nothing if my being ends,

line_1: Death soon shall waft me to some unknown shore,
line_2: Where labours end, and sorrows are no more:

line_1: Where labours end, and sorrows are no more:

line_1: Where patriot heroes in the peaceful shade
line_2: No factions threaten, and no foes invade;

line_1: Where long oblivion, ending anxious strife,
line_2: Stills the wild hurry of a noisy life;

line_1: Stills the wild hurry of a noisy life;

line_1: Or where all joys with heart-felt ease abound,
line_2: Whilst youthful spring for ever blooms around.

line_1: Whilst youthful spring for ever blooms around.

line_1: Come then, dear pledges of connubial joy,

line_1: Next, to your mother all this scene impart;
